intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subvitellicolor, commonly known as the pale-yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its yellowish flowers and hairy stems, which help it retain moisture in dry conditions. Its leaves are typically basal and have a rough texture, while the flowers are arranged in a composite head. Hieracium subvitellicolor is often found in meadows and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
